oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Buddy Killen Interview Side Two - Tree International
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Allen interviewing Buddy Killen of Tree International. The recording takes place on 8-31-79.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Buddy Killen
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:04) -- Buddy Killen continues discusses his goals for Tree Publishing Company's growth. (1:01) -- Bob Allen asks about Don Gant's role at Tree Publishing Company and Don's history at Acuff/Rose. (2:10) -- Bob Allen changes the subject back to the purchase of the Pamper catalog. (3:22) -- Buddy Killen discusses purchasing conditions for Tree Publishing Company when Tree purchases a catalog. (4:12) -- Bob Allen asks Buddy Killen how many writers are currently signed to Tree Publishing Company. Bob goes on to ask about whether certain writers are jealous of each other. (5:07) -- Buddy Killen describes how writers will pitch each other's songs. (6:31) -- Buddy Killen discusses Curly Putnam's guidance to other songwriters. (7:25) -- Buddy Killen describes his relationship with Sonny Throckmorton. (9:11) -- Buddy Killen mentions that he keeps a low profile as a songwriter/"songcraftsman." (9:55) -- Bob Allen asks Buddy Killen about who he considers his competitors. (12:01) -- Buddy Killen describes his personal motivation to continue to grow. (13:06) -- Bob Allen compares Acuff/Rose to Tree Publishing Company. (14:42) -- "I compete with myself. I'm not really trying to knock anybody out but me." - Buddy Killen. (15:54) -- Bob Allen asks about Rafe Van Hoy and how he joined Tree Publishing Company. (17:39) -- Bob Allen asks about the group Equinox. (18:51) -- Bob Allen asks about what studios Buddy Killen produces in. Buddy Killen personally owns two studios. (20:52) -- Bob Allen asks Buddy Killen about whether his divorce changed his professional life. (23:23) -- Bob Allen asks about the total value of all publishing businesses in Nashville. (25:56) -- Bob Allen asks Buddy Killen about his personal background as a musician and when he first came to Nashville. (27:51) -- Buddy Killen tells a story about being behind on car payments and having his car towed. (30:28) -- Buddy Killen describes becoming a session musician, songwriter, singer, and publisher. "Through the years doing that has given me a tremendous overview of the business." (33:14) -- "Without pain you can't have depth." - Buddy Killen. (35:16) -- "When you are swimming in self-pity, people let you drown." - Buddy Killen.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Killen, Buddy;
